subject: MCUTempSensor: Add support "ScaleValue" label
commitMessage:
MCUTempSensor: Add support "ScaleValue" label

- In some MCU temp, like PCH, the resolution of temp data
  is 1/2 or 1 according spec, and scale is not 1000.
  So using "ScaleValue" parameter to replace hardcore
  scale value 1000.
  If the ScaleValue <= 0 or not found in json,
  it will print error and set to default value 1000.

TEST:
- If define "ScaleValue" in json,
{
    "Bus": 12,
    "Address": "0x30",
    "Reg": "0x40",
    "Class": "MCUTemp",
    "Name": "MCUIC",
    "ScaleValue": 100,
    "Thresholds": [
        {
            "Direction": "greater than",
            "Name": "upper critical",
            "Severity": 1,
            "Value": 84.0
        }
    ],
    "Type": "MCUTempSensor"
}
~# busctl introspect xyz.openbmc_project.EntityManager /xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/board/PCH/MCUIC xyz.openbmc_project.Configuration.MCUTempSensor
NAME                                                        TYPE      SIGNATURE RESULT/VALUE     FLAGS
.Address                                                    property  t         48               emits-change
.Bus                                                        property  t         12               emits-change
.Class                                                      property  s         "MCUTemp"        emits-change
.Name                                                       property  s         "MCUIC"          emits-change
.Reg                                                        property  t         64               emits-change
.ScaleValue                                                 property  t         100              emits-change
.Type                                                       property  s         "MCUTempSensor"  emits-change
~# busctl introspect xyz.openbmc_project.MCUTempSensor /xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/MCUIC xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value
NAME                                                  TYPE      SIGNATURE RESULT/VALUE                             FLAGS
.MaxValue                                             property  d         255                                      emits-change
.MinValue                                             property  d         0                                        emits-change
.Unit                                                 property  s         "xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value.Unit.… emits-change
.Value                                                property  d         92.17                                    emits-change writable

- If not define "ScaleValue" in json,
{
    "Bus": 12,
    "Address": "0x30",
    "Reg": "0x40",
    "Class": "MCUTemp",
    "Name": "MCUIC",
    "Thresholds": [
        {
            "Direction": "greater than",
            "Name": "upper critical",
            "Severity": 1,
            "Value": 84.0
        }
    ],
    "Type": "MCUTempSensor"
}
~# busctl introspect xyz.openbmc_project.EntityManager /xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/board/PCH/MCUIC xyz.openbmc_project.Configuration.MCUTempSensor
NAME                                                        TYPE      SIGNATURE RESULT/VALUE     FLAGS
.Address                                                    property  t         48               emits-change
.Bus                                                        property  t         12               emits-change
.Class                                                      property  s         "MCUTemp"        emits-change
.Name                                                       property  s         "MCUIC"          emits-change
.Reg                                                        property  t         64               emits-change
.Type                                                       property  s         "MCUTempSensor"  emits-change
~# busctl introspect xyz.openbmc_project.MCUTempSensor /xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/MCUIC xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value
NAME                                                  TYPE      SIGNATURE RESULT/VALUE                             FLAGS
.MaxValue                                             property  d         255                                      emits-change
.MinValue                                             property  d         0                                        emits-change
.Unit                                                 property  s         "xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value.Unit.… emits-change
.Value                                                property  d         8.961                                    emits-change writable

Signed-off-by: Harvey.Wu <Harvey.Wu@quantatw.com>
Change-Id: Ia07112f0675897b5b1f4cfcd7a17b439a638681d

Generally its if the scale is omitted entirely.  a scale of 0 would be invalid.
Updated the commit message.
Add a tested section, mentioning existing behavior was not broken + proper scale factor was read in case EM had scale factor configured.
Done.
Other than the comments, the code looks good to me.
scale is already a double, why are you static casting it?
Done to remove it.

Was this configuration newly added to entity manager? 
I just want to know about backward compatibility, as in if EM configuration does not have "ScaleValue", how will this code work? will loadVariant throw any error?

We need to make sure in that case also we use default value.

The "Scalevalue" is already in configuration(https://github.com/openbmc/entity-manager/blob/master/schemas/legacy.json#L207).

About loadVariant function, if the key name doesn't in EM configuration, it will throw error(https://github.com/openbmc/dbus-sensors/blob/master/include/Utils.hpp#L138).
I change to use try...catch to catch error and then set default value.

> Was this configuration newly added to entity manager? 
> I just want to know about backward compatibility, as in if EM configuration does not have "ScaleValue", how will this code work? will loadVariant throw any error?

+1.  You need to check for existence of this parameter.

> 
> We need to make sure in that case also we use default value.

Sorry, I don't really understand the existence meaning.
The "ScaleValue" is already in schemas/legacy.json.
https://github.com/openbmc/entity-manager/blob/master/schemas/legacy.json#L207

And this parameter is used in dbus-sensors/IpmbSensor
https://github.com/openbmc/dbus-sensors/blob/master/src/IpmbSensor.cpp#L492
https://github.com/openbmc/dbus-sensors/blob/master/src/IpmbSensor.cpp#L402

Do there something I missed?

@Ed, in latest patch he has added try catch for the same. 
That is, if "ScaleValue" is not found we will default to 1000.

This means that user in EM configuration made it zero rt? and since zero is a invalid value we default to 1000. 

Let's make it a bit more fool proof by adding <= 0, to handle negative scale factors.

I just don't want the scale input value is zero by user, because this parameter is used to fraction calculation.
About negative scale value, on second thoughts, I change to detect <=0, not just =0.
This should throw an exception.  a scale value of 0 is invalid.
Done.

I'm not understanding this statement.  Isn't the scale for the MCU pre-defined?  Given this daemon only supports a single device, it seems odd that we would need an explicit scaling in the configuration options at all.  Why would a system configure the scaling value to anything different than what the device supports?

Please answer in more detail in your commit message.

Hi Ed,
In my system, we need to get the PCH temp, but it is saved as degree without any scale. So I want to add support "ScaleValue" to get the direct temp data. I added more detail to commit message.
This is a single device......  Its scaling is already known.  "direct temp data" doesn't really answer the question.

So why aren't these just encoded as part of the MCU device data?  Why would a user choose a scale that's different for that index?  This seems like something that shouldn't be configurable, unless there are multiple variants of MCU that can be configured differently, which doesn't appear to be the case here.

I'm not really understanding your meaning.
In MCUTempSensor, the reading value return from i2c_smbus_read_word_data(https://github.com/openbmc/dbus-sensors/blob/master/src/MCUTempSensor.cpp#L139). So I think it is possible that have different scale.

For PCH example,
in 9-series-chipset-pch(https://www.intel.com/content/dam/www/public/us/en/documents/datasheets/9-series-chipset-pch-datasheet.pdf 22.2.1), the resolution of temp is 1/2, so the result value cannot divide by 1000, should be 2.
in 495 Series Chipset(https://www.intel.com.tw/content/www/tw/zh/products/docs/chipsets/495-series-chipset-on-package-pch-datasheet-vol-2.html 4.3.58), the resolution is 1, so the result value should divide by 1.

So I want to let the value 1000(https://github.com/openbmc/dbus-sensors/blob/master/src/MCUTempSensor.cpp#L172) could be set.

Question:

In case of failure to find "ScaleValue" we need to default to 1000. This you are doing rt now. 

But scale <= 0 is a exception. There also are we planning to use default value? or assume wrong configuration and call "continue;"

You mean when scale input value <= 0, ignore build this sensor and print error message. And then continue to build other MCU sensors?
Hmm... Maybe it's a better way.

I am not suggesting that, it's a question. 
May be Ed or maintainers can take a call on that.
